alert.note: Alert for Graham (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 03 at 3:28PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN GRAHAM COUNTY THROUGH 345 PM CDT... At 328 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Nicodemus, or 12 miles northeast of Hill City, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Graham County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northwestern Kansas.
